1.text: Boil 4 cups (950 milliliters) of water in a large pot.

2.text: Take the pot off the stove, and add 4 to 6 tea bags into the water.

3.text: Let the tea steep for 3 minutes.

4.text: Take the tea bags out of the water.

5.text: Let the tea reach room temperature before you place it into the fridge.

6.text: Leave the tea in the fridge until it becomes cold.

8.text: Pour the chilled tea into the glasses, and stir in some honey, if desired.

9.text: Fill a tall glass with 1 cup (240 milliliters) of cold or room temperature water.

10.text: Add 1 green tea bag, or the equivalent of loose-leaf tea.

11.text:
Cover the cup or pitcher, and put it into the refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours[11]
X
Research source



 This will give the tea enough time to brew and infuse the water with its delicate flavor.

12.text: Fill a tall glass with ice.

14.text: Pour the chilled tea into the ice-filled glass.

15.text: Sweeten the tea with honey, if desired, and serve.

16.text: Fill a mug with ½ cup (120 milliliters) of boiling water.

17.text: Add 1 green tea bag into the water, and 2 tablespoons of sugar, if desired.

18.text: Let the tea brew for 3 minutes, then take out the tea bag.

19.text: Squeeze the juice out of 2 lemons, and add it to the tea.

20.text: Add 1 cup (240 milliliters) of cold water, and stir.

22.text: Pour the green tea lemonade over the ice.
